We were looking at your website, and we
see that you're not just Starbucksing these days.
You're also interested in what's called third wave coffee.
Can you explain what third wave coffee is to the listeners?
So the first wave was that crappy Folgers Maxwell House
coffee that you would get pretty much anywhere in the '60s.
Then Starbucks came along and raised the bar for coffee
by buying the higher quality Arabica beans.
And they were really, really good for a few decades.
And they were the best thing that you could get in a given
city for quite a while.
Then at some point, maybe in the '90s,
this third wave came along of roasters
that started putting a lot of effort
into sourcing really high quality beans,
roasting them much lighter than Starbucks does,
and experimenting with brewing methods that really bring out
the flavor.
And those are the coffee shops that I've
